triplets: Leafy vegetable cultivated for its edible leaves and commonly used in fresh dishes
Eating fresh, making salads, sandwiches, wraps, and garnishes
Edible leafy greens composed mainly of water, fiber, and nutrients
Outer leaves that provide texture and nutritional value
Central stem or head, depending on lettuce variety
Typically green; some varieties exhibit red or purple tinges
Vegetable farming systems, fresh produce markets, and culinary food chains
Various farmers and agricultural producers cultivating leafy vegetables
Approximately 300–600 grams per head depending on variety
Typically 7–14 days after harvest when refrigerated properly
